headline: Rich and Creamy Beef Stroganoff
description: This beef stroganoff recipe with sour cream and cream cheese is a cozy dish of tender beef and mushrooms in a thick gravy seasoned with red pepper.

video.description: The rich and delicious classic Russian dish.
video.name: Rich and Creamy Beef Stroganoff

name: Rich and Creamy Beef Stroganoff
recipeIngredient: 2 (2 pound) beef chuck roast, cut into 1/2-inch thick strips
1 teaspoon salt, or more to taste
0.5 teaspoon ground black pepper, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place beef into a large bowl. Stir in red wine, salt, and black pepper. Marinate for 10 minutes, then remove beef and pat dry with a paper towel. Reserve remaining marinade.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in beef; cook and stir until browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer beef to a plate, then drain any remaining grease from the skillet.

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in the skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion, garlic, and a pinch of salt. Cook and stir until onion is soft and translucent, 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer onion mixture to the plate with beef; set aside.
Melt 2 tablespoons butter in the skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms; cook and stir until tender, about 10 minutes. Transfer mushrooms to a bowl; set aside.

Melt 1/4 cup butter in the skillet over medium heat. Whisk in flour; cook and stir until flour no longer tastes raw, about 4 minutes. Slowly whisk in beef stock. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, then reduce heat to medium-low.

Pour in reserved marinade, Worcestershire sauce, red pepper flakes, and mustard, then add beef and onion mixture. Cover and simmer until meat is tender, about 1 hour. Season with salt and black pepper.
Stir in mushrooms, cream cheese, and sour cream about 5 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: I thought this was fantastic. So good to find a beef stroganoff recipe that doesn't call for a can of cream of mushroom soup. The only thing I might do differently is to cut back a little bit on the red pepper flakes.

The only changes I made were the meat, had stew meat on hand, and the cream cheese, left out because I didn't have, used a little extra sour cream. Turned out fantastic! The red wine gives it a rich yummie flavor. Will definitely make this again!!
Made this last night, was super easy and delicious!

I have been making this for about 2 years and it is a huge hit in our home. My daughter's boyfriend will eat half of the pan if you let him, so I double the sauce ingredients to make it go a little farther. I've used all cuts of beef and they all work fine, you just have to simmer some longer than others. I only use a sprinkle of red pepper flakes since I know that any more would ruin the dish for my family. This dish is very rich but that is probably why it's so good! There is a reason the reviews are so good.
I changed one thing about this recipe ~ I used a slow cooker for 6 hours. Turned out great. My grown kids LOVE it.
This was by far the best stroganoff I have ever made. I did double the wine though!

Absolutely fantastic. Instead of the simmering in a pan, I put in a slow cooker—about 2 1/2 hours—and it really came together in the last 45 minutes. Used white wine. Added cream cheese at very end and just a couple of teaspoonfuls of sour cream—don’t think it needs much, if any, and it’s got such exquisite flavours already
My husband asked me to make beef stroganoff for his birthday. Found this recipe and decided to give it a try. Delicious! He loved it!
Yummy!!!

This is hands down my favorite dish of all time. I follow the recipe exactly as it is. No one has ever given me anything but stellar feedbacck on this dish. I cannot make it often as it is SO good the temptation to overeat is overwhelming! Thank you so much for this fabulous recipe.

I did the recipe as printed. I used Chuck steak but I was worried it wouldn’t be tender enough so I put it in my pressure cooker for 10 minutes. I made this for my husband and he loved it! I will definitely prepare this again! Yum 😋
Great dinner dish. I did not add the creqm cheese. Excellent

Loved it! It’s really really good! Serving to to houseguests tonight. I used leftover New York steak because it’s what I had, and tried to cut back a little on the amount of butter. Other than that - exactly as directed in the recipe.
This is now our go to family beef stroganoff recipe! Instead of cream cheese we just add extra sour cream. Turns out delicious!
Great flavor!! Family loved it. Served it over egg noodles. Only thing I would do different next time is use a bit less red pepper. It was a tad to spicy for me but my hubby loved it!!!

This stroganoff recipe was the best I have ever had, my family was here for dinner and they devoured everything not even a left over so I could have for dinner the next night. I will be making this again. Thank you for your recipe.

There is a reason this recipe has almost 800 5 star reviews, mine being one of them. This is a nice hearty, warm , filling meal on a midwestern wintery evening. I made step by step. Thanks to original cook for sharing. My daughters and I loved it.

Dang this is good!! every payday I review the contents of the fridge, and see what needs to be used; then I find recipes ( mostly on this site), and plan to purchase anything needed to complete the recipe, using my leftovers. I had roast beef and mushrooms, so the search returned this recipe. need wine? Yeah, there's an open bottle on the counter. Sour cream, cream cheese, beef broth? yep, open containers of all of those! and of course I had onions, mustard, spices, and worcestershire. I didn't need to buy another thing! Score!!!! and it is SO good, my husband didn't realize we were eating leftovers, which he hates. A fabulous recipe.
loved it!
Awesome recipe. It's a keeper we loved it..
Excellent recipe. I reduced the red pepper flakes to 1 tsp. and used a flank steak since beef is so high right now.
Best stroganoff we've made. Used leftover round roast. Cut the red pepper in half, that's plenty hot. Full amount would have drowned out the delicious flavor of the sauce.

OMG this was sooooo good! I made it exactly like the recipe says. It took a while, but not difficult and well worth the wait. Everyone at the dinner table raved about it and I have some very picky eaters. I will definitely save this recipe and make it again.

I giving it 5 stars because I'm a hero with my family right now. Now my wife doesn’t like traditional beef strips so I used ground beef. I was able to simplify the preperation. Very easy actually and this will be my stroganoff recipe from now on!

I was looking for something with more flavor as my old one was really boring. This is a keeper! The different flavors blend so well, giving it such a rich flavor. So happy to have found and tried this!

It was a lot of work and both my husband (who LOVES spicy food) and I thought the red pepper flakes didn't belong in a stroganoff. Other than that, it was quite tasty, but will try a different dish next time that is less work and see how it compares. If it doesn't, will come back to this one and leave out the red pepper.

I used a chuck roast that I sliced super thin. As I was making the dish I was thoroughly aggravated at the steps to cook and remove from the pan but got passed that. As I added the 2 tsps of crushed red pepper I almost only added one because I thought that was way too much for a traditional beef stroganoff being a dish that originated from Germany or Russia but I went ahead and added it. Wish I would've stopped at one and maybe even only half a tsp. When I make this the next time I definitely will use way less crushed red pepper because I cannot take away but I can add.

This was a great recipe, but I changed a few things for this second make. I used French's Dijon mustard that had chardonnay in with it, ribeye instead of chuck roast, used half the red pepper flakes, and I added about an eighth a cup of heavy cream to it. The original was great enough to try doctoring it a bit this second time, so you can see what your tastes prefer! I highly recommend, and it's great for a keto diet!

It turned out really good! I didn't have the red wine, but used a white that I don't think changed the recipe at all. I was looking for something a little more in line with a true German Recipe though. I'll try another.

BEST EVER!! This was outstanding! Easy & Quick to make, definitely will cook it again, Soon!
I made a few small changes, added double the sliced mushrooms, and since my hubby is a master griller, he lightly grilled Rib eye steak (One Rub used prior to grilling) then I sliced into bit slice strips then into the sauce.... Bam!!

This recipe was very good. I made it exactly as listed. My only criticism is that if you don’t like spicy food, cut back on the red pepper flakes. I love is so it was perfect for me. Next time, I’m going to double the sauce so I can use it for leftovers.

My husband and I made it together. We did not substitute anything. The only thing we did different was cooked the meat in the slow cooker to make sure it was very tender. I didn’t actually eat any because I’m on a strict diet but husband said it was yummy. Put a spoonful of sour cream on top of his plateful. Will definitely make again.
It was absolutely DELISHIOUS. My kids devoured this. Sooo good.
Tastes all come together in one big flavor fest! It takes some time and I got started late in the day. I had some cooked brisket that saved a little time. But after all was done it was great!
My husband LOVES this. He said it’s one of his favorite things I’ve ever cooked for him.
I just left a glowing review, but I forgot to mention that I used ground beef :)

Whenever I ask my husband what he wants for dinner he always asks for this! I've made this so many times now and I can tell you there are two things that make this dish- the meat and the wine. 

Choose a wine that you enjoy drinking. I like a full bodied red. A Cabernet Sauvignon, Zinfandel, or a Malbec work nicely. Doesn't need to be fancy, it just needs to taste good. 

Now for the meat this is a little trickier. Some types are too chewy and that will not cook down in this. Choose your meat wisely, it's worth it to splurge here. Sirloin worked well.

I never made this with the red pepper flakes so if you have to cook for someone who doesn't like spicy just don't add any and this dish is amazing!
there is NO mustard, red wine, pepper flakes, and not nearly enough Worcestershire
Loved this recipe! Delish! The only thing I did differently was I used way more mushrooms (We love them!) and I sauted them right along with the onions and garlic. Thanks for the great recipe!

My wife and I loved this recipe! I followed the recipe with only one exception, I used sirloin because that’s what I had in my freezer, but everything else was as directed and it came out awesome. Leftovers heated up quite well and was amazing again.
I added 10zo of portabella mushrooms and the family loves it!

This recipe is the best, I've made it once and it is in my personal cookbook. I didn't change anything but the red pepper flakes. The 1st time I made it I followed the recipe. It was a little hot for my family so I cut the flakes in half and we had perfection.

I followed the recipe exactly except for the red wine, which I didn’t have on hand and it was a sunday and couldn’t get any locally, but recalled a somewhat similar recipe but a biit more stewlike that used brandy/cognac, so i gave it a try as I did have some. It works just fine. It has a slightly different flavor not but not enough to disappoint anyone except the absolutely pickiest among us.

It was excellent! Didn’t use mushrooms because I made it for guests who don’t like them. It was still great! I used beef tenderloin and saved the juice from the meat after browning. I added it to the leftover marinade and then added 1/2 cup to the sauce. It gave it a rich flavor. I didn’t use red pepper flakes, but added a dash of cayenne. I served it over homemade egg noodles. Yummy!
Excellent!
Soooo tasty!
Terrific as is! Everyone loves this hearty dish. You can change the recipe for whom you’re cooking for. Such a pleasure to make and enjoy a glass of red wine with it!

Love this recipe... it reminds me of my childhood in the 1970s. We don't eat meat, so I subbed in 2 lbs of Beyond Meat ground "beef" and use no-chicken Better Than Bouillon to make the broth. I cook the onions, mushrooms and garlic together and add in the Beyond ground as the onions start to soften. I never remove anything from the pan... I just do the sauce right on top of everything (easy peasy). We LOVE this dish and my daughter asks for the "creamy hamburger pasta" now pretty often. It's become one of our go-to comfort dishes. I especially like this recipe as it does NOT use cream of mushroom soup, which I don't care for and a lot of stroganoff recipes call for.

The flavor was spot on even without adding mustard (which I don't like). I would either have to cut the beef into smaller pieces or, like another reviewer said, buy a better cut of meat since even with these cooking times the meat ended up tough. Apart from that, I really enjoyed this meal and will make it again.
This was good . Beef needs cooked longer to be tender and smaller pieces.
I made this recipe just as written, except I used only a “pinch” of the red pepper flakes. It was perfect as a special dinner to make for family and friends. Will definitely be making this again
Very tasty, but the cream cheese makes it very heavy.
This was OUTSTANDING! A definite keeper. The whole family absolutely loved it. Best Beef Stroganoff I've ever eaten or made.

So I marinated the meat in red wine with salt and pepper. Then I melted some butter and the virgin olive oil together and cooked the meat until brown. After that I added in the flour (stirred into a little water first) and the beef broth as well as a little bit of the reserved wine marinade. I cooked it until it thickened up and then added the mushroom and let that simmer for about 10 minutes. Then I added garlic and let simmer for 3 minutes. Lastly I added the cream cheese and sour cream and stirred for 5 minutes. I then poured the meat, mushrooms, and sauce over wide egg noodles. This meal was delicious and definitely didn't need to cook for an hour. I would say I completed mine in about 30 minutes. My husband, kids, and myself finished our plates! I omitted the red pepper and onion for my kiddos.

Sooooo good! I used left over Prime Rib from our holiday dinner. Other than that, the only thing I substituted was Boursin garlic and herb cheese for cream cheese because it’s what I had on hand. Knocked our taste buds into another realm...a Heavenly, creamy, beefy realm. Husband is already asking for it again next week.

My husband used this recipe and added his own twist to it. It was the best stroganoff I have ever had. He swapped out the large onion with the whites of green onions and used about a1/4 C, added horseradish (1tsp) when cooking beef, onion and garlic. He used 1 tbs of red pepper and .the leftover standing rib we had from our holiday meal.
Took less than hour. It was easy to make and was amazing!
SO yummy! Used high quality steak (it easier to cut thinly while the meat is thawing out and still partially frozen), the sauce was SUPER thick so I thinned with a bit of extra beef stock.
Love this recipe. Will be cooking again!
Absolutely Delicious! I made it exactly as stated with the exception of the red pepper flakes. I did not add them and I don't think they were missed.

Made this almost exactly as written....(except I doubled it) 
Have a grand daughter that isn't fond of pepper... was super nervous at step 4 when I was tasting the roux.... before adding the wine....
Holy moley! This recipe rocks!! Very impressed.. thanks so much for a great recipe! .. my old fave had lawrys...ate half my plate without, then put some in.... amazingly good both ways. .. so I'll leave it out. . Kind of low salt which is awesome.
Best ever. Won my guy's heart. Thanks!

Very good! I did cut the crushed red pepper flakes in half!
It was just right!
delicious
Absolutely perfect. I’ve made lots of other beef stroganoff recipes, but this one beat them all.

As advertised, it does take quite a while to prepare. But very tasty. Will definitely make it again, but will leave out the red pepper flakes next time. It's not that the spice tastes bad, it's just not something you expect from a stroganoff.

Made this and hubby loved! Great taste and not difficult to make. I used a pressure cooker to tenderize beef. I sautéed onion and mushrooms in a separate pan and then combined with beef. Made sauce in Pan that I sautéed onions, etc in and poured over beef and mushrooms mixture. Served with noodles and fresh green beans. DELICIOUS! And a recipe to make again and again.
Followed the recipe with no changes. It tastes great! Love it!
Has a bit of a kick, but super tasty.

Wow. I made this again and we could have had 3 bowls if we didnt control ourselves. 
We love adding the red wine and cream cheese. 
I also used cambells beef consume to add that extra flavor.

I have made this recipe twice. The first time I made it according to the recipe. I wasn't happy with it. I thought it was because I used that cheap table wine they sell in the vinegar/oil aisle. I made it again this week using a decent cabernet and it still tasted like something was missing. I had to add a lot of salt to bring out any flavor and it still tasted like something was missing. The flavors didn't complement one another. It did taste a little better the next day, but still not happy with it.

This is my favorite beef stroganoff recipe out of all I have tried. I typically use a London broil (top round or sirloin), and it comes out tender and delicious. I haven't changed it much, but I didn't think it was necessary to reserve the mushrooms for later. I also use about twice as many mushrooms as it calls for, but I love mushrooms.
Sliced the onions into strips to add a little extra "noodly" effect. Very tender beef.
This was so good.
Perfect! Thanks for sharing

OMG this was good. I didn’t have any wine which I’m sure would have made it even better. Other than that I followed the recipe as written. I have used many recipes for beef stroganoff as it was my son’s favorite dish growing up. I’m adding this to my favorites.
excellent! subbed a quart of canned venison for the beef.

Very creamy and rich, delicious. A definite recipe to make again!

A few tweaks, I added more beef stock as it simmered so as not to dry out. Added 16 oz container of mushrooms sliced thin, 1 cup not enough. Watch the red pepper flakes, I only added 1 tsp and I thought perfect but other family members found too hot. So adjust the heat index for your family.

I'm not sure what the cut of meat was since it was given to me. I used chanterelles that we foraged today, I increased the amount but next time would add even more. For the broth, I used better than bouillon. I skipped the spicy pepper but followed everything else. Imade this in my cat iron pan. It was delicious!

I made it as prescribed. Very good recipe for this comfort food. I didn't have any egg noodles, so I used bow ties. As this is a cream based sauce, I recommend adding a few shakes of any Louisiana style hot sauce because that somehow seems to create umami.
Very good beefy version. Next time I'll leave out the red pepper.

I followed the recipe except for reducing the amount of red pepper flakes and cream cheese but that's personal preference. It's the cooking time that was the big issue for me. I used chuck roast and simmered for over an hour but needed more time to get tender. Next time I may just throw it in the oven. The flavor was awesome!

We love Stroganoff and make it with leftover tritip from a Sunday dinner. This got super husband approval. So creamy and the flavor has a hint of sweet but yet so savory. This will be my recipe from now on. No changes.

Yes... used heavy cream 8 Oz and doubled receipe added carrots and peas for color at end .

Compared with other recipes. Some asked for cream Fraise , some cream cheese , some heavy cream . 

Chose this recipe as one I could make fast ( 1 1/2) . I was making meals for others as gifts. 

Turned out very good.

This tastes amazing! It’s really flavorful and pretty simple to make. I did end up adding an additional cup of beef broth because there wasn’t as much gravy as I prefer. Also turned out quite spicy with the 2 tsp of crushed red pepper. I would do max 1 tsp or skip all together if you don’t like spicy!

So good! The only thing I did differently was add more beef broth because the roux was too thick. Absolutely delicious.. also only simmered it for 30 minutes and it was tender. A little bit involved but incredibly good. Everyone asked for seconds!
It was a really nice, easy, delicious recipe. I made it just like the recipe said. There were no leftovers how ever. : (
This is a wonderful recipe. Classic beef stroganoff. Cut back on salt the second time. Used beef tenderloin the first time, short cooking time. used chuck the second time long cooking time.
Yuck! Mustard and red pepper flakes made this beef stroganoff too strong. Also, using a chuck for the beef was a poor choice...tough and not appealing. Would not use this recipe again.
I made this tonight for dinner. It is very tasty. I let the sirloin marinade for about 1 hour, really flavorful and creamy . Will make it again.
My daughters favorite when she comes home from college.
This was delicious! My whole family loved it! The only change I made was subbing Dijon mustard for the yellow mustard. Will definitely be making again and again!

Great flavor. 

 I was in a rush so skipped the mushrooms and roux. didn't have mushrooms but would have added as it would have amped up the flavor a bit more. 

Added 1lb of egg noodles pre- al dente to finish in the pot and thicken up the sauce since I didn't add flour. worked very well. 

For me 2 Tsp of pepper flakes was too much. 1tsp would be perfect. can always add more if you want just before adding sour cream. 

Also julienned onions instead of chopped.

I had been looking for a way to use meat I had left over: beef rib meat from a barbecue I hosted a few months ago and some cheap steaks that had sat in my freezer for half an eternity. This dish did the trick. I doubled the amount of wine in the marinade because of the quantity of meat I had, and I used a mix of canned and fresh mushrooms. The end product came out beautifully - the chewy rib meat had been rendered tender by the marinade and slow simmering.

First time making stroganoff. This was simple to follow and was definitely, "not like mom used to make". I had to cut the pepper flakes in half, knowing my families tolerance. But this was absolutely phenomenal. I served it with egg noodles.

EXCELLENT!!!
I have a picky brood but this recipe conquered!!!
DOUBLE UP ON STOCK, SOUR CREAM AND CREAM CHEESE TO MAKE ENOUGH FOR SECOND HELPINGS. I also added half and half.

I didn't have red wine so I used white cooking wine, and I did not have cream cheese so used extra sour cream. I thought the flavor was really good and I would make it again! Also only cooked it for 30 minutes instead of an hour because I started late and we were starving. Recommend doing an hour so meat gets more tender.
definitely will make again. Really, really good....rich but good!
definitely will make again. Really, really good....rich but good!
